trans-unit.source: Provides a read-only container for a collection of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> objects.
This collection inherits from <xref:System.Collections.ReadOnlyCollectionBase>.
The only way to add <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> objects to this collection is to use the class constructor.
This collection provides two indexer properties, a string indexer and an integer indexer.

The string indexer property returns a component in the collection by name if the <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent.Site%2A> property of a component in the collection is not `null` and the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite.Name%2A> property of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent.Site%2A> property of the component matches the specified string.
The integer indexer property returns the <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> at the specified collection index.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.ComponentCollection.CopyTo%2A> method copies the contents of the collection to a specified array, beginning writing to the array at the specified index.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ComponentCollection"></xref> class using the specified array of components.
This method adds each <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> in the specified <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> array to the collection.
An array of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> objects to initialize the collection with.
Copies the entire collection to an array, starting writing at the specified array index.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> array to copy the objects in the collection to.
The index of the array at which copying to should begin.
Gets the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref> in the collection at the specified collection index.
This method can be overridden by a derived class.
The collection index of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref> to get.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> at the specified index.
If the specified index is not within the index range of the collection.
Gets any component in the collection matching the specified name.
This method can be overridden by a derived class.

This property returns an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> in the collection if its <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent.Site%2A> property is not `null` and the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite.Name%2A> property of its <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent.Site%2A> property matches the specified string.
This string indexer works only when the component is sited, which typically occurs only at design time.
To site a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component> at run time, set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component.Site%2A> property of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component>.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite.Name%2A> property of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite> set to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent.Site%2A> property must also be set for this property to return the component.
The name of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> to get.
A component with a name matching the name specified by the name parameter, or `null` if the named component cannot be found in the collection.
